verses.verse: The burden<WH4853> of Nineveh<WH5210>. The book<WH5612> of the vision<WH2377> of Nahum<WH5151> the Elkoshite<WH512>.

Jehovah <WH3068> is a jealous<WH7072> God<WH410> and avengeth<WH5358>; Jehovah<WH3068> avengeth<WH5358> and is full of wrath<WH1167>; Jehovah<WH3068> taketh vengeance<WH5358> on his adversaries<WH6862>, and he reserveth<WH5201> wrath for his enemies<WH341>.

Jehovah <WH3068> is slow<WH750> to anger<WH639>, and great<WH1419> in power<WH3581>, and will by no means<WH5352> clear<WH5352> the guilty<WH3068>: Jehovah hath his way<WH1870> in the whirlwind<WH5492> and in the storm<WH8183>, and the clouds<WH6051> are the dust<WH80> of his feet<WH7272>.

He rebuketh<WH1605> the sea<WH3220>, and maketh it dry<WH2717>, and drieth up<WH3001> all the rivers<WH5104>: Bashan<WH1316> languisheth<WH535>, and Carmel<WH3760>; and the flower<WH6525> of Lebanon<WH3844> languisheth<WH535>.

The mountains<WH2022> quake<WH7493> at him<WH1389>, and the hills melt<WH4127>; and the earth<WH776> is upheaved<WH5375> at his presence<WH6440>, yea<WH8398>, the world, and all that dwell therein<WH3427>.

Who can stand<WH5975> before<WH6440> his indignation<WH2195>? and who can abide<WH6965> in the fierceness<WH2740> of his anger<WH639>? his wrath<WH2534> is poured out<WH5413> like fire<WH784>, and the rocks<WH6697> are broken asunder by him<WH5422>.
Jehovah <WH3068> is good<WH2896>, a stronghold<WH4581> in the day<WH3117> of trouble<WH6869>; and he knoweth<WH3045> them that take refuge in him<WH2620>.
But with an over-running<WH5674> flood<WH7858> he will make<WH6213> a full end<WH3617> of her place<WH4725>, and will pursue<WH7291> his enemies<WH341> into darkness<WH2822>.
What do ye devise<WH2803> against Jehovah<WH3068>? he will make<WH6213> a full end<WH3617>; affliction<WH6869> shall not rise up<WH6965> the second time<WH6471>.
For entangled<WH5440> like thorns<WH5518>, and drunken<WH5433> as with their drink<WH5435>, they are consumed<WH398> utterly<WH4392> as dry<WH3002> stubble<WH7179>.
There is one gone forth out<WH3318> of thee<WH2803>, that deviseth evil<WH7451> against Jehovah<WH3068>, that counselleth<WH3289> wickedness<WH1100>.

Thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>: Though they be in full strength<WH8003>, and likewise many<WH7227>, even so shall they be cut down<WH1494>, and he shall pass away<WH5674>. Though I have afflicted<WH6031> thee<WH6031>, I will afflict thee no more.
And now will I break<WH7665> his yoke<WH4132> from off thee<WH5423>, and will burst thy bonds<WH4147> in sunder<WH5423>.

And Jehovah<WH3068> hath given commandment<WH6680> concerning thee<WH8034>, that no more of thy name be sown<WH2232>: out of the house<WH1004> of thy gods<WH430> will I cut off<WH3772> the graven image<WH6459> and the molten image<WH4541>; I will make<WH7760> thy grave<WH6913>; for thou art vile<WH7043>.

Behold <WH2022>, upon the mountains the feet<WH7272> of him that bringeth good tidings<WH1319>, that publisheth<WH8085> peace<WH7965>! Keep<WH2287> thy feasts<WH2282>, O Judah<WH3063>, perform<WH7999> thy vows<WH5088>; for the wicked<WH1100> one shall no more<WH3254> pass through<WH5674> thee<WH3772>; he is utterly cut off.
